Client Class

Defined in: lib/index.js:223
Module: mobstor

JavaScript wrapper of MObStor client.

Configure connection information

var config = {
    // mandatory
    host : "your.mobstordomain.name",
    // optional, defult 80
    port : 80,
    certificate : (new yca.YCA()).get_cert("your.application.id"),
    // proxy information is optional for access from corp network to product network
    proxy : {                            
        host : "yca-proxy.corp.yahoo.com",
        port : 3128
    }
};

//Create a client instance
var client = mobstor.createClient(config);

// Call API
try {
     client.storeFile("/test.txt", content1, function(error, data) {
         if(error!=null) {
             // handle error object
             // error.code: http status code (can be undefined if the error is not caused by HTTP error)
             // error.message: error message
         }
         else {
             // data is JavaScript Stream object
         }
     });
}
catch(error) {
     // error handling..
}

Methods

checkFile

(
  • path
  • callback
)

Defined in lib/index.js:398

checkFile method returns only the HTTP headers for a object or folder. This method provides a quick way to check whether an object has changed since it was last fetched, or to simply verify that a particular folder exists.

checkFile uses HTTP HEAD method internally. The HEAD method is preferred over the retrieveFile method for checking a resource's existence or fetching its metadata, since it does not download the object's contents.

Please read http://devel.yahoo.com/mobstor/guide/head.html for more information.

Parameters:

  • path String

    Object path

  • callback Function(error, data)

    Callback function

(

  • callback

Defined in lib/index.js:531

Implementation of HEAD API [http://devel.yahoo.com/mobstor/guide/head.html]

Parameters:

    Directory to be created

  • callback Function

    Callback function

    Callback function

getSignedUrl

(
  • url
  • expiry
  • callback
)

Defined in lib/index.js:566

Get signed/tokenized url

A signed URL is a read-only URL that is valid for only a short period of time - i.e., a URL with an expiration date. It provides time-limited access to an otherwise private MObStor object.

In contrast to the auto-expires feature, a signed URL does not affect the lifetime of the actual stored object. Signed URLs can be created for expiring as well as auto-expiring content.

Please read http://devel.yahoo.com/mobstor/guide/ch03s05.html#SignedURLs for more information.

Parameters:

  • url String

    URL to be signed/tokenized.

  • expiry Number

    Expiration time in seconds from request time

  • callback Function(error, data)

    Callback function

retrieveFile

(
  • path
  • callback
)

Defined in lib/index.js:355

Retrieves the contents of an object. Retrieving on a folder is allowed, but returns an unspecified response body.

You can also use checkFile to retrieve information about a folder.

Please read http://devel.yahoo.com/mobstor/guide/get.html for more information.

Parameters:

  • path String

    Resource to be read. Data read from MObStor will be store in the body parameter

  • callback Function(error, data)

    Callback function

storeFile

(
  • path
  • data
  • callback
)

Defined in lib/index.js:306

Creates a new resource or updates the value of an existing resource. If the resource does not already exist, then MObStor creates the resource and returns a 201 Created response. If the resource already exists, then MObStor overwrites the object's current contents and header values.

The maximum URL length for PUT requests is 1024 bytes.

Please read http://devel.yahoo.com/mobstor/guide/put.html for more information.

Parameters:

  • path String

    absolute path of full uri of the destination

  • data String/Object

    String or readable stream to be stored. If data type of this parameter is object, then JSON.stringify string will be stored.

  • callback Function(error, data)
